channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024031041
item.description:
Report X-2024031041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: OREM
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO (2) PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z85E85Y0217815894. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND PERISHABLE. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SEVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM UTAH USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 85E85Y, WASATCH WAGYU, 30661 OLD LINCOLN HWY, COALVILLE UT 84017-9611.

item.title: Report X-2024030833
item.description:
Report X-2024030833

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LOOSE CAPS LEAKING DURING TRANSIT, UNLOADED, PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID INSIDE A WET SOILED OPENED BOX SOILING ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024030453
item.description:
Report E-2024030453

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: WEST VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 19, 2024, one (1) 300-gallon tote of UN2810 was crushed by falling freight and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel completed a tote transfer into one (1) new tote that was staged onsite. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2810-impacted materials were containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report E-2024030498
item.description:
Report E-2024030498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of KEM 400 Enamel Omaha Orange High Gloss released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading (it was double stacked, and freight crushed it). The release impacted the trailer floor and one other 5-gallon metal pail of product. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2024031036
item.description:
Report X-2024031036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: Salt Lake City
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipping container EMHU 643693 leaking in the rail yard. Inspection showed 2 5 gallon buckets leaked a total of .5 gallon each of material. No blocking and bracing present. Crew decontaminated container and over packed the two breached 5 gallon buckets then repackaged and blocked the remaining buckets.
